comparison.title: Comparing Traditional & Modern Pilonidal Sinus Treatments

definition.title: What is a Pilonidal Sinus?
definition.content: A pilonidal sinus is a small hole or tunnel in the skin at the top of the buttocks, where they divide (the cleft). It does not always cause symptoms and only needs to be treated if it becomes infected.

symptoms.title: Symptoms
listItems: Pain and redness at the bottom of the spine
Swelling and pus or blood draining from the abscess
Unpleasant smell from the infected area

treatment.title: Treatment Options
treatment.content: Treatment for a pilonidal sinus will depend on your symptoms. If it's not causing any problems, it's often better to leave it alone. However, you should seek medical advice if you have any of the symptoms of an infection, such as pain and swelling.
